maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the HBAs installed on the specific computer.
Retrieves the Host Bus Adapters installed on the specific computer.

maml:introduction.maml:para: Retrieve the HBAs for computer named Server01

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve serial numbers for FlashArray volumes
This will display the serial number information for FlashArray volumes.
Retrieves the Quick Fix Engineering patches applied to the local computer.
This cmdlet will display all of the QFE patches applied to the local computer.
Retrieves any volume shadow copies.
Retrieves any volume shadow copies that exist on the host.
Produces a capacity report for Pure FlashArray

This cmdlet will produce a capacity report that contains information on Volumes, Snapshots, and total capacity for a Pure FlashArray. There is also an optional pie chart image file that can be produced and linked in the report.
If declared, a piechart.png file will be created and linked to in the report.
If declared, a piechart.png file will be created and linked to in the report.

maml:introduction.maml:para: Create a capacity report for the specified array, prompting for the array credentials, saving the HTML output file to C:\temp\output.html, and include the pie chart image.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a report on FlashArray volumes connected to Hyper-V.

This cmdlet will generate a Excel report that contains detailed information on Hyper-V volumes and VMs. The ImportExcel module is required and this is checked for at runtime, and if it does not exist, it will be installed. Windows features Hyper-V PowerShell and Rsat-Clustering-PowerShell are required. These are checked at runtime and if they do not exist, they are installed.
FlashArray IP address
Virtual machine (VM) CSV temporary file name.
Windows CSV temporary file name.
FlashArray CSV temporary file name.
Excel output filename
FlashArray IP address
Virtual machine (VM) CSV temporary file name.
Windows CSV temporary file name.
FlashArray CSV temporary file name.
Excel output filename
Creates a new volume shadow copy.
This cmdlet will create a new volume shadow copy on the local computer.
Registers all host volumes with the host OS.
This will register all host volumes with the host OS and bring them to a status of "online".
Set the default Windows Power Scheme on the local computer
Sets the default Windows Power Scheme of the local computer to "High Performance"

maml:introduction.maml:para: Set the Windows PowerScheme in the Registry to High Performance

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronize two FlashArrays Host specific port settings.
This cmdlet will synchronize Host iSCSI and Fibre Channel settings between FlashArrays.
Source endpoint IP address or FQDN.
Target endpoint IP address or FQDN.
iSCSI or Fibre Channel
Source endpoint IP address or FQDN.
Target endpoint IP address or FQDN.
iSCSI or Fibre Channel

maml:introduction.maml:para: Sync settings betwwen EndPOintA and EndPointB for Fibre Channel.

maml:description.maml:para: Runs several Pure recommended Best Practices tests on the local computer.

This cmdlet will run various Pure Storage recommended Best Practices tests and queries on the local computer, prompting for approval for any changes before they are implemented. These tests include settings for MPIO hardware and software verification, iSCSI TCP settings, and TRIM and UNMAP.

maml:alertSet.maml:title: Registry changes may occur with this cmdlet if approved by the user.

maml:alert.maml:para: It is highly recommended that a registry backup be completed before running this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Unregister all host volumes with the host OS.
This will unregister all host volumes with the host OS and bring them to a status of "offline".
Updates local drive information.
Updates drive information including drive letter and label on the local computer.

maml:introduction.maml:para: Update the drive letter from H to M and apply a new label of NewDriveM

maml:description.maml:para: Disable insecure TLS protocol and enable secure TLS protocols

This cmdlet will disable TLS version 1.0 and enable TLS versions 1.1 and 1.2. TLS version 1 is no longer in mainstream support. TLS 1.1 and 1.2 are required for certain PowerShell functions and Web Applications. This cmdlet will modify the registry. It is highly recommended that a backup of the registry is taken before executing this cmdlet.
